Top_5_Brands: ['St Louis Lager', 'St Louis Export', 'Carling Black Label', 'Castle Lite', 'Windhoek Lager']
Review_Snapshot: High consumption driven by heat; St Louis is praised as the ultimate 'thirst quencher'. High preference for imported RSA brands.
Strict adherence to Reinheitsgebot (Purity Law). Users claim Windhoek gives 'no hangovers' due to lack of additives.
Regab is a national icon. Reviews often mention the '65cl' bottle size as the standard unit of social currency.
SeyBrew is synonymous with the island lifestyle. Reviews focus on lightness and freshness.

Digital_Retail_Points: ['Checkers Sixty60', 'Pick n Pay asap!', 'Checkers Sixty60', 'Takealot App']
Review_Snapshot: Highly diverse palate. 'Zamalek' (Carling) is legendary for strength. Massive craft beer sub-culture in Cape Town/Joburg.
Cuca is the undisputed King. Reviews emphasize the need for beer to be served 'stupidly cold' (Estupidamente Gelada).
A 'Guinness Country' - distinct preference for strong, dark, bitter stouts over lagers.
Zambezi is the premium choice for tourists; Chibuku (opaque beer) is the staple for the working class, praised for nutrition.
Laurentina Preta (Dark) is often cited as the best dark lager in Africa. 2M is the standard party beer.
Safari Lager is reviewed as 'strong' and 'serious'. Kilimanjaro is the lighter, more refreshing option.
Nile Special is cult-status. Reviews focus on its high ABV (5.6%) and quality consistency. 'True Reward' is the slogan.

Digital_Retail_Points: ["EABL's The Bar", 'Drinks Vine', 'Dial a Drink Kenya']
Review_Snapshot: Tusker is Kenya. Reviews celebrate the 'Tusker Time' bonding. Rising popularity for Ciders and Lite beers.

Top_5_Brands: ['Club Premium Lager', 'Star Beer', 'Guinness FES', 'Tale Beer', 'Ruut Extra']
Review_Snapshot: Club Beer is described as 'crisp and distinct'. Guinness Foreign Extra Stout has a massive, loyal following.
Huge market for Stout (Guinness/Legend). Star Lager is the standard. Regional loyalty is high (Hero in the East, Trophy in the West).
Beer is deeply integrated into culture. St. George (Kidame) is iconic. Habesha is praised for its 'Cold Gold' marketing.
